title: Tennessee SEA response

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Tennessee SEA response
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documentation submitted to the U.S. Department of Education's Student Privacy Policy Office in response to the office's March 28, 2025, request for records such as "'reports, information on policies and procedures, annual notifications, training materials or other information necessary' to provide assurance that the SEA and their respective LEAs are complying with the provisions of FERPA and PPRA".

I have attached a copy of the SPPO's request letter for reference. The relevant section is found on the last page, under "Assurance of Compliance". The SPPO requested the documentation be submitted no later than April 30, 2025. If the Tennessee Department of Education sent communications to the SPPO requesting an extension or declining to submit the documentation, I request a copy of said communications.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Ileana Garnand.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Tennessee SEA response
communications.communication:
Mr. Hoover. Your request has been received. Current estimate is 60 days. This is only an estimate. Some requests take more or less time.

Thanks!
Brian
--
[cid:image001.png@01DBBF2D.FA17AA10]

Brian Blackley | Director of Media
Andrew Johnson Tower, 9th Floor
710 James Robertson Parkway, Nashville, TN 37243
Brian.Blackley@tn.gov<mailto:Brian.Blackley@tn.gov>
615-968-1495

#TNBestforAll

We will set all students on a path to success.

title: Email Metadata

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Email Metadata
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. The following metadata for emails sent by all accounts operated by the governor's office between the dates of April 7, 2025 and April 18, 2025: Sender, Recipient (To, CC, BCC), Date and time sent, Subject. As this is a request for metadata, please do not include the email body in the returned records.
2. Governor Ferguson's April 2025 calendar

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

Your request was received in this office on 4/21/2025 and given the reference number R001969-042125 for tracking purposes.  NOTE:  The day the request is received does not count as one of the five (5) days.  Weekends and holidays observed by the agency are also excluded in the calculation.  If your request has been submitted after normal business hours, on the weekend, or on a holiday, the date received is the next business day. RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of April 21, 2025, Reference # R001969-042125 

Dear Rose Terse, 

Thank you for your interest in public records of the Office of Governor. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW. The WA State Office of the Governor received a public information request from you on April 21, 2025. Your request mentioned: 
"To Whom It May Concern: Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 1. The following metadata for emails sent by all accounts operated by the governor's office between the dates of April 7, 2025 and April 18, 2025: Sender, Recipient (To, CC, BCC), Date and time sent, Subject. As this is a request for metadata, please do not include the email body in the returned records. 2. Governor Ferguson's April 2025 calendar: The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. Sincerely, Rose Terse 

The WA State Office of the Governor has reviewed your request and has determined that the records requested are exempt from disclosure under Washington Public Records Act; therefore, certain information in the records released today are redacted for the following reasons: 
Pursuant to RCW 42.56.520, within ten business days, you may petition in writing, a request for review of this decision. Please submit the request for review to: 

Deputy Legal Counsel 
PO Box 40002 
Olympia, Washington 98504-0002 

An installment of records responsive to your request is available to you now in the Public Records Center. Login to the Public Records Center and retrieve the records. 

We estimate the next installment to this request will be available on or before 7/23/2025.  If public records become available in advance of this estimate we will contact you promptly. Conversely, if the WA State Office of the Governor encounters a need to extend our estimate, we will contact you promptly with a revised estimated date. 

Please be advised that if you do not either download these records or access them for inspection on or before May 29, 2025, the request is considered to have been fulfilled and is closed on that date for failure to inspect records. This means that the Office of the Governor will not further address the request, and that will be the date from which the PRA’s one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review starts to run. Please contact me within 30 days by e-mail or at P.O. Box 40002, Olympia, Washington 98504-0002, if you have any questions. 

If I can be of further assistance, you may contact Tricia Smith at [564] 200.2106. 

Thank you for your patience in awaiting this information. 

Sincerely, 

/S/ 
Tricia A. Smith

title: Police disciplinary files (Pacific County Prosecuting Attorney)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police disciplinary files (Pacific County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Moe Clark

title: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order (Walla Walla Police Department)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order (Walla Walla Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

title: Police Data Collection Request (2019-2021)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Police Data Collection Request (2019-2021)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by year, from 2019-2021.

2. the total number of use of force incidents, separated by type of force and year used from 2019-2020 (for example, information that specifies the number of taser incidents in 2019, baton incidents in 2019, etc.)

When available, I would appreciate being sent individualized data for each item in this request in spreadsheet format. If individualized data are unavailable, please send information that includes aggregate statistics for the item instead.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.communication:

communications.subject: Pierce County Records: Sheriff - P037849-071325:: P037849-071325
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 


 
RE: Pierce County Sheriff PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of July 13, 2025, Reference # P037849-071325. 
July 21, 2025 
Dear Rose Terse, 
In accordance with the Public Records Act, RCW 42.56, this letter acknowledges receipt of your request for records dated 7/13/2025 7:47:39 PM and received by Pierce County Sheriff on 7/14/2025 8:30:00 AM.  Your request asks for the following: 
“To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

The 25 most recent police report narratives that were generated using Axon Draft One between 6/1/2025 and the date this request is received. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fpierce-county-sheriffs-department-888%252Faxon-draft-one-pierce-county-sheriffs-department-189406%252F%253Femail%253DSHRpublicrecords%252540co.pierce.wa.us&url_auth_token=AAAThf5dx1wrOii1jvbtTSetgQU%3A1ub9CL%3ANgJ9VvmhI53H8raEtorFAMZXu4bu9lnPscREyKwrENU” 
The Pierce County Sheriff is currently processing a high volume of public record requests (approximately at the time of this letter). Records which are responsive to your request, to the extent that they exist at all and are subject to the Public Records Act, will have to be identified, located, and reviewed. Requests which include video, body worn camera, and/or dash camera recordings will require additional review time for applicable exemptions to disclosure. Additional fees will apply. 677 
Due to the number of requests currently open and the scope of law enforcement records, we anticipate that your request may be processed in installments, and we estimate that we will be providing a first installment of records to you by . If records are ready sooner, or if we determine that additional time or information is needed to complete your request, you will be notified. Thursday August 21, 2025 If your request involves many types of records which may take a substantial amount of time, please let us know if you would like us to prioritize any specific records. 
You may also wish to contact these other agencies for any records they may maintain:

--- Please respond above this line --- 


 
RE: Pierce County Sheriff PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of July 13, 2025, Reference # P037849-071325. 

July 23, 2025 

Dear Rose Terse, 

In accordance with the Public Records Act, RCW 42.56, this letter regards your Pierce County Sheriff public records request.  Your request asks for the following: 

“To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

The 25 most recent police report narratives that were generated using Axon Draft One between 6/1/2025 and the date this request is received. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fpierce-county-sheriffs-department-888%252Faxon-draft-one-pierce-county-sheriffs-department-189406%252F%253Femail%253DSHRpublicrecords%252540co.pierce.wa.us&url_auth_token=AAAThf5dx1wrOii1jvbtTSetgQU%3A1ub9CL%3ANgJ9VvmhI53H8raEtorFAMZXu4bu9lnPscREyKwrENU” 
Pierce County Sheriff has completed its search for the requested records. The final production of responsive records has been identified and released to you via the Public Records Request Portal. Please log back into the " My Request Center" within the portal to access all released records. Select this request and select "View Files". At this time, I am closing this request in that we have completed our search and disclosed the records we have identified as responsive to your request. 
This agency believes it has fully processed this request in accordance with the Public Records Act; this letter is the final and definitive response. Please be advised that the Public Records Act’s one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review has started to run as of the date of this letter because this agency does not intend to further address your record request. Please be advised that you can contact this agency within the next thirty days to ask any follow-up questions regarding the processing of this request. 
This request is now closed. 
Sincerely, 
Kellie Harris 
Public Records Officer 
Pierce County Sheriff

title: 2009 Crime Incident ata Request (Lafayette Police Department)

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: 2009 Crime Incident ata Request (Lafayette Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on crime incidents—those classified by your agency as crimes—rather than calls for service or unfounded incidents.
• Year(s) Requested: 2009
• Columns Requested: Incident date, Incident time, Type of crime (e.g., robbery, theft, etc.), Incident ID, and all other available columns that do not require additional processing by the agency or redaction.

If the data are stored in a proprietary or custom electronic format not publicly available, I request that it be converted to a format viewable with standard software, such as Microsoft Excel or CSV. Please avoid providing data in PDF or paper printouts.

This request is made to support academic research conducted in the public interest and is not for commercial purposes. The data will contribute to a research project assessing the effect of music concerts on crime, aiming to enhance public understanding of how large events influence community safety.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kristina Block

title: Traffic Stop Records

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Traffic Stop Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

all data, including statistical information, collected from any Massachusetts Uniform Citation (“MUC”) issued in the Commonwealth between January 1, 2020 and June 2025.

Some important fields may include:

City of Boston Employee ID (6 digit ID)
Badge Number
Employee first name
Employee middle name
Employee last name
Rank
Incident Number
District/Taskforce
Date of Stop
Time of Stop
Location of stop
Latitude/longitude
Race of driver
Gender of driver
Age of driver
If search occurred
If contraband was found

If any of these fields are unavailable, please reach out and let us know!

I also request a waiver of all fees for this request, as disclosure of the requested information to me is in the public interest and will contribute to the public’s understanding of operations and activities of the government. This request is being made for research conducted by Spark! at Boston University and will not be used for commercial use.

I expect the request to be filled in an electronically-accessible format, including for screen readers, excel, or CSV. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents. We understand that the data may be large in size, so feel free to send it over in year or half-year increments.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. If you believe any of this information to be exempt, I ask you to please cite the specific portion of the law on which you rely. I also ask you to please redact any information you believe to be exempt and disclose the rest. If you need to discuss this request, I can be reached at 617-358-8514.

Sincerely,
Boston University SPARK!

title: Evergreen Solutions (Jefferson Community College)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Evergreen Solutions (Jefferson Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:


Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you.

Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable)
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held
Pay Grade
Pay Ranges (Min& Max)
Current Step (if on a step plan)
Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent)

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

title: New York State participation in Value Pricing Pilot Program

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: New York State participation in Value Pricing Pilot Program
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All communications by the government of the State of New York with regard to tolling authority through the Value Pricing Pilot Program.

Of greatest interest is any communication which refers to New York State's consent as part of the tolling authority, including those which refer to withdrawal or withholding of consent. 

Specific scope is the following: 

Recipients may have included Administrator of the FHWA as well as Office of Innovative Program Delivery;
Senders would be from the office of the Governor of New York State or the New York State Department of Transportation;
Dates from the start of January 2023 to the end of June 2024;
Phrases potentially responsive to search would be "Value Pricing Pilot Program", "Congestion Pricing", "Central Business District Tolling Program", "Congestion Relief Zone."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

T. McElwee

title: Texas Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order (Johnson County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Texas Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order (Johnson County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Tepper

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request: Texas Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety search audits, network sharing, and general order (Johnson County Sheriff)

title: ALPR Audit (Madison County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: ALPR Audit (Madison County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Scott Kampas

communications.subject: Sheriff's Office Public Records :: S003297-060825
communications.communication:
Dear Scott Kampas: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Madison County, IL. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with Illinois Freedom of Information Act, 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq.. Your request was received in this office on 6/8/2025 and given the reference number S003297-060825 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Scott Kampas

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fmadison-county-sheriff-11243%252Falpr-audit-madison-county-sheriff-187419%252F%253Femail%253Djmlinton%252540co.madison.il.us&url_auth_token=AAA3K6SnXFZAI4-kHeoOCy8_lXg%3A1uOU2D%3Ad0fKXXdfjlYnsSX0dCGAGQA3dU3-I6OiV76lISMjPSI 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The Illinois Freedom of Information Act, 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
Madison County, IL

title: DEI Policy Communications Jan. 1, 2022-present (Virginia Military Institute)

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: DEI Policy Communications Jan. 1, 2022-present (Virginia Military Institute)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All internal communications (emails, memos, meeting minutes, reports, texts) regarding the creation, modification, or discontinuation of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) programs or offices.

2. All communications related to funding or budgets allocated specifically to DEI programs or initiatives, including internal discussions of potential changes.

Timeframe: January 1, 2022–present.

If responsive records reside on personal email accounts or messaging apps used by officials for public business, those should be included per Virginia FOIA law. This request covers communications and documents produced, sent, or received by board members, administrators, or staff acting in their official capacity. Clearly state if records are withheld and applicable FOIA exemptions, if any.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or USB drive if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with IAMN.

communications.subject: [External Message Added] Virginia Military Institute public records request #25-49
communications.communication:
Virginia Military Institute ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #25-49: After consultation with the individuals responsible for the information you requested, I have determined that the estimated cost of fulfilling your request is $981.72. As you may be aware, § 2.2-3704. F. of the Code of Virginia allows public bodies to charge for accessing, duplicating, supplying, redacting or searching for the requested records. This estimate reflects the following staff time: * IT search (records search): 8 hours @ $48.65 per hour * Chief Diversity Officer (records search): 4 hours @ $56.27 per hour * FOIA Assistant (request coordination): 4 hours @ $25.66 per hour * FOIA Officer (review and redaction): 4 hours @ $66.20 per hour Please note, this is only an estimate of the cost of fulfilling your request. The actual cost may vary. In accordance with Virginia Code § 2.2-3704(H) and VMI General Order 5, a request that exceeds $200 will not be processed until payment of a deposit not to exceed the amount of the estimated cost has been received from the requester. If you agree to the estimate, you will be sent an invoice and, once payment is received, VMI will begin to process your request. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Virginia Military Institute.
Technical support: See our help page

title: R.I. Homicide Logs

communications.subject: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: R.I. Homicide Logs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the State Police's Homicide logs, which should identify case numbers, detective names, weapon(s) used, location of homicide, motive and manner, and any other information the department has listed for homicides. I request such records for homicides that took place between Jan. 1, 2020 to present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexa Gagosz

title: South Carolina Freedom of Information Act. Request: South Carolina Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (University Of South Carolina Upstate)

communications.subject: South Carolina Public Records Law Request: South Carolina Freedom of Information Act. Request: South Carolina Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (University Of South Carolina Upstate)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Rhode Island Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

communications.communication:
Good morning,

On July 15th we sent a response to your FOIA request.  I'm sorry that you did not receive the information.

We resent the information today and if you do not receive it, please let us know.

Thank you,

Lauren Greene

Executive Assistant

Finance & Administration

800 University Way, Spartanburg, SC 29303

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Roster Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

In excel and/or csv format:
all officers who have been employed by Boston Police Department over the past 4 years. Please include first name, last name, badge numbers, rank, Agency Code. 

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
BU SPARK!

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: B002914-100624
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
Reference No: B002914-100624 Dear Vijay Fisch: The Boston Police Department (BPD) has received your request for public records.  This response applies only to records that exist and are in the custody of the BPD. See A Guide to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, p. 32, n.115.  It is expected that a custodian of records must use her superior knowledge of her records with respect to responses to public records requests.  950 CMR 32.04(5).  Specifically, you stated: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records: 

In excel and/or csv format: 
all officers who have been employed by Boston Police Department over the past 4 years. Please include first name, last name, badge numbers, rank, Agency Code. 

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage. 

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 
BU SPARK! 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fboston-police-department-174%252Froster-request-174096%252F%253Femail%253Dshawn.williams%252540boston.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj3fcYLuG3tA1ygoUNI_ZMLII%3A1sxdBr%3AHe1dJpyBVhPAE3DDp0gVJVDbSm3jog6-nFESVqXSWlI A response to a public records request must be provided within ten (10) business days from the business day a written request was received.  G. L. c. 66, § 10 (a); 950 CMR 32.06(2)(b).  The public records law permits a response time of up to twenty-five (25) business days from the business day a written request is received, so long as a detailed explanation is provided.  G. L. c. 66, § 10(b)(vi); 950 CMR 32.06(2)(i). Due to the nature of your request additional time is needed.  As such, BPD will need up to, but no more than, fifteen (15) additional business days to review and process your request.

communications.communication:
Hi I am away from the office.


Please contact paul.chong@boston.gov or grace.jung@boston.gov if you

You can submit a public records request or check the status of a
request at anytime through our online portal:
https://bostonma.govqa.us/WEBAPP/_rs/(S(pwgy1kfre2evykakw3nlpalu))/supporthome.aspx


Thank you.

Dear Vijay, 
I have a quick question about this request in particular. You mention "Agency Code". 
Could you please let me know what that entails? In the meantime, the majority of your request is on-line at https://data.boston.gov/dataset/employee-earnings-report/resource/e2e2c23a-6fc7-4456-8751-5321d8aa869b 
Please take a look at that and let me know about the Agency Code and I can follow up. 
Thank you, 
Martha 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Center. communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request #B002914-100624
communications.communication:
Hi Martha, 

I hope you are doing well! This employee earnings report is super helpful-- I think instead of Agency Code I should had written Assigned Task/District. I would be grateful if we could include whether the officers are assigned to a BPD District or are in a special unit -- what field would this be? Disregard Agency Code. Thank you! 

Vijay

title: Defector Nguyen Thanh Son / JCRC Refugee Reference T84-278

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Defector Nguyen Thanh Son / JCRC Refugee Reference T84-278
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, I hereby request access to records concerning Nguyen Thanh Son, also known as Son Nguyen Tan or Manh Du, a North Vietnamese defector who provided information about American POWs in the Ba To region, Quang Ngai Province, South Vietnam after the ceasefire agreement in 1973. Nguyen Thanh Son may also be the refugee known as 'Son Nguyen Tan' with JCRC reference number T84-278, who was a former ARVN SSG, Interpreter for the 3rd Bde TF, US 4th Inf Div.

Specifically, I am seeking:

1. All interrogation reports, debriefing documents, recordings (including transcripts in any language) and communications related to Nguyen Thanh Son’s defection, particularly those dated on or after March 22, 1973. 

The following artefacts from the National Archives pertaining to this request are provided for reference: 

- AMEMBASSY SAIGON message 111035Z JUN 73 to SECSTATE IMMEDIATE 2984 [https://www.loc.gov/item/powmia/pwmaster_117133/]

- USDAO SGN RVN message dated 110900Z JUN 73 referencing  [https://www.loc.gov/item/powmia/pwmaster_65641/]

- USDAO SGN RVN message dated JUN 5, 1973  [https://www.loc.gov/item/powmia/pwmaster_44839/]

2. Records or intelligence reports regarding sightings of American POWs in Vietnam mentioned by Nguyen Thanh Son on or after March 1973.

3. Investigation and intelligence reports evaluating the credibility of Nguyen Thanh Son’s claims about American POWs.

4. Internal memos and briefings citing Nguyen Thanh Son’s information on American POWs in Vietnam.

5. Correspondence between US government agencies regarding Nguyen Thanh Son’s defection and the resulting analyses regarding his claims.

6. All files and documentation of the refugee with JCRC reference number T84-278 such as those referenced in the National Archives: 

- JCRC-LNB memo to JCRC 25 NOV 1984 [https://www.loc.gov/item/powmia/pwmaster_31991/]

- REPLY TO REQUEST FOR INFORMATION ON SOURCE. [https://www.loc.gov/item/powmia/pwmaster_31993/]

- NVA DEFECTOR DETAILS PLOT. REVEAL ICCS SABOTAGE ORDERS, FROM NEW YORK TIMES. [https://www.loc.gov/item/powmia/pwmaster_31994/]


If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $50. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in accordance with 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii). I am a private individual seeking information for personal purposes and not for commercial use. Disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because it is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of government operations and activities regarding this issue.

If any portion of the information is exempt from disclosure, please provide me with the non-exempt portions. If the requested records are in an electronic format, I would prefer to receive them via email or on a CD-ROM if email is not feasible.

Please acknowledge receipt of this request and provide me with an estimated completion date. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response.

Sincerely,

Benjamin Bagley

title: Contract Documents for GPS at Massachusetts Sheriffs Offices (Middlesex County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Contract Documents for GPS at Massachusetts Sheriffs Offices (Middlesex County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All contract documents related to your GPS monitoring program, including the name(s) of the GPS provider(s) your office contracts with. I also request a copy of the current contract with your GPS provider(s), and any regulations, policies, or procedures your office uses to govern the GPS program.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joshua Dankoff

title: Shooting Records

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Shooting Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Under SB1421, I am requesting records related to the shooting of Jimmy Lopez, who was shot and killed by Hemet Police Officers on July 4th, 2024. 

I am requesting all recordings, including video and audio of the incident
Incident reports
Autopsy reports
Names of officers involved (https://www.kcra.com/article/calif-court-orders-release-of-names-in-police-shootings/6414094)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Shooting Records
communications.communication:
Hello, 

Court decisions say you have to release the names of officers, their names do not jeopardize an investigation, and are subject to disclosure. The public interest outweighs the 
 https://law.justia.com/cases/california/supreme-court/2014/s200872.html 

Furthermore, SB1421 requires the department to release records related to police shootings. They are exempt from permanent disclosure as an investigatory record. There is no right to privacy in cases of officer shootings. 
https://leginfo.legislature.ca.gov/faces/billTextClient.xhtml?bill_id=201720180SB1421

Upon invoking this post-60-day delay, and at subsequent 180-day intervals for each subsequent delay, the Departments must provide in writing to the requester, the specific basis for the Departments' determination that it has reason to believe that disclosure will interfere with the criminal investigation of the officer who engaged in misconduct or used force, or of someone other than the officer who used force. In addition, this writing must include the estimated date for disclosure of the withheld information. In any event, the Departments must provide the information when the specific basis for withholding is resolved, the investigation or proceeding is no longer active, and in no case later than 18 months following the use of force incident, whichever occurs sooner. Cal. Penal Code § 832.7(b)(8)(A)(ii).

At most, you have 18 months since July 4th, 2024, to delay the release.  You must provide the above requirements for the continued delay in releasing records. 

Thank you

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Washington State Electric Vehicle Charging Program
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to all awardees of the state's Electric Vehicle Charging Program. For each grant recipient, I request:

* Grant applications
* Progress reports, milestone reports, and other periodic reporting documents
* Documents containing proposed and actual charging station locations
* Budget documents, including proposed and actual expenditures
* Amendments or modifications to original grant agreements
* Final project completion reports, if available

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Washington State Electric Vehicle Charging Program
communications.communication:
Please see the request below.

______________

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to all awardees of the state's Electric Vehicle Charging Program. For each grant recipient, I request:

* Grant applications
* Progress reports, milestone reports, and other periodic reporting documents
* Documents containing proposed and actual charging station locations
* Budget documents, including proposed and actual expenditures
* Amendments or modifications to original grant agreements
* Final project completion reports, if available

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cody Harris

communications.subject: PUBLIC RECORD REQUEST :: P001706-022425
communications.communication:
Dear Cody Harris: 
Thank you for submitting your request for the following records: Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to all awardees of the state's Electric Vehicle Charging Program. For each grant recipient, I request:

* Grant applications
* Progress reports, milestone reports, and other periodic reporting documents
* Documents containing proposed and actual charging station locations
* Budget documents, including proposed and actual expenditures
* Amendments or modifications to original grant agreements
* Final project completion reports, if available

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cody Harris

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fdepartment-of-commerce-5573%252Fwashington-state-electric-vehicle-charging-program-181987%252F%253Femail%253Dcommercewa%252540govqa.us&url_auth_token=AABCmuzFKtmgaEDpBVZ8oaaurWw%3A1tmVcc%3AK_8lGdblEB62snyonBN54QiuRaT9ULcqLLafr2eq5hA 
 
Your request was received in this office on 2/24/2025 and given the reference number P001706-022425 for tracking purposes. 
Your request is being processed in accordance with the State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW.  You will be contacted within five (5) business days with an update as to when the responsive records will be available.  You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 
PLEASE NOTE: The State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW, does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 
Again, thank you for your interest in public records of Department of Commerce. 
Department of Commerce

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

RE: PUBLIC RECORD REQUEST # P001706-022425 
Dear Cody Harris, 
The Department of Commerce received a public records request from you on February 24, 2025, for the following: "To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Records related to all awardees of the state's Electric Vehicle Charging Program. For each grant recipient, I request: 

* Grant applications 
* Progress reports, milestone reports, and other periodic reporting documents 
* Documents containing proposed and actual charging station locations 
* Budget documents, including proposed and actual expenditures 
* Amendments or modifications to original grant agreements 
* Final project completion reports, if available 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Cody Harris 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fdepartment-of-commerce-5573%252Fwashington-state-electric-vehicle-charging-program-181987%252F%253Femail%253Dcommercewa%252540govqa.us&url_auth_token=AABCmuzFKtmgaEDpBVZ8oaaurWw%3A1tmVcc%3AK_8lGdblEB62snyonBN54QiuRaT9ULcqLLafr2eq5hA" This letter serves as a 5-day acknowledgement of your request. The request has been assigned the following reference number – P001706-022425. PLEASE NOTE THAT A HIGH VOLUME OF REQUESTS IS RESULTING IN A PROLONGED DELAY OF RESPONSES TO RECORD REQUESTS. 
In conducting a search for records, we would like to determine whether there is any further clarification you would like to provide in order for us to best respond to your request. 
Without further clarification from you, we interpret your request as: "You want records related to all awardees in the most recent contract(s) round of the state's Electric Vehicle Charging Program." Along with everything else you listed above in your request submission. 

We would appreciate hearing from you with regard to clarification on this.  Please reply to this request within 7 business days, on or before 03/05/2025. In the event we do not hear from you within 7 business days, on or before 03/05/2025, we will begin to produce records in response to your original request terms and in accordance with our interpretation. 
Based on your response with regard to clarification, or our interpretation of your request if we receive no response from you, we will attempt to gather, identify and review records responsive to your request. We estimate an initial installment of records responsive to your request will be made available to you on or before 04/01/2025. 
Thank You, 
Lynne Hayes 
Program Specialist 5/Public Disclosure Specialist 
Operations Division Office Services

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #P001706-022425
communications.communication:
Thank you for the prompt response.

My understanding, per publicly available information on the Electric Vehicle Charging Program, is that to date there has been one round of contracts awarded since the program began and that a second round has not yet opened for applications.

If my understanding that there has so far only been one contracts round completed is correct, then your interpretation of my request as pertaining to the most recent (and only) contracts round is acceptable.

If there has been more than one round, then I will clarify that my request pertains to the time period when the program began, which is reportedly Tuesday, September 26, 2023, to February 1, 2024, when an announcement of the program’s awardees was made.

Thank you,
~Cody Harris

title: Fire Truck Repair (Oakland Fire Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Fire Truck Repair (Oakland Fire Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Recent media reports suggest that the cost of purchasing and maintaining fire trucks has increased in recent years: https://www.thebignewsletter.com/p/did-a-private-equity-fire-truck-roll?utm_source=post-email-title&publication_id=11524&post_id=155466046&utm_campaign=email-post-title&isFreemail=true&r=44j01&triedRedirect=true&utm_medium=email

Therefore, I request the following:

A list of all fire truck repair parts purchased by this fire department in for the years 2005, 2010, 2015, 2020, 2024, and 2025, along with their prices.
Planned and actual budgets for fire equipment service and parts for 2005, 2010, 2015, 2020, 2024, and 2025 

Any repair manuals, repair part catalogs, repair invoices, or repair contracts created by this fire department or received by third parties for the years 2005, 2010, 2015, 2020, 2024, and 2025

A copy of any warranties, non-disclosure agreements, contracts, liability waivers, insurance agreements, Requests for Proposals, Responses to Requests for Proposal, Memorandums of Understanding, Letters of Interest, usage policies, or informal agreements between the fire department and American Industrial Partners or REV Group.

A copy of any reports to legislative bodies or annual reports that mention American Industrial Partners or Rev Group sent to oversight bodies.
Communications, contracts, and presentations sent to/from/between REV Group (including E-ONE, KME, Ferrara, Spartan, Smeal, LTI) or Pierce (@piercemfg.com) and this department)

Please try to include any other miscellaneous documents that facilitate this department's repair of fire trucks that don’t neatly fit into the categories above. Except where specifically noted (requests #1, 2, and 3), please search between January 1, 2024 and the time this request is published.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jason Koebler

communications.communication:
Oakland, CA ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #25-3767: The Oakland Fire Department (OFD) has received your public records request. This message serves as the initial response in compliance with the California Public Records Act (Gov. Code § 7920 et seq).  OFD will provide any responsive records we may have, subject to any necessary redactions and/or exemptions. Certain records may be withheld from disclosure as authorized by law under the California Public Records Act. If a record consists of information that is exempt from disclosure by law, any reasonably segregable portion of a record will be provided to you after the exempt information is removed.   If OFD staff have questions or require clarification to fulfill your request, we will post additional messages to this request portal. In the same manner, if you have questions regarding your request, please post a message here.  Non-exempt, responsive records will be uploaded to this request as promptly as possible.  Please Note: If your request includes plans, they will not be uploaded here. California Health & Safety Code § 19850-19851 requires an affidavit signed by the requester and the signed authorizations of both the Professional who created the plans and the property owner prior to duplication. We may, however, schedule a viewing appointment, where you can review the plans. No authorizations are needed for a viewing appointment; however, No photos, videos, tracing, or other methods of duplication are allowed at the appointment. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

We are in receipt of your recent request related to apparatus maintenance, warranties and contracts with misc. vendors. Thanks very much and we are happy to facilitate a response.

This is a complex item. OFD is the end user of the fire apparatus and benefits from consistent repairs, however the City's Public Works Dept manages the acquisition, contracting and maintenance process for city's fleet of vehicles.

We are going to share your request with their point of contact in order to gather the items as soon as possible.

Please let me know if you have any questions, keep in touch.

Michael Hunt

title: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Department of Corrections)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Department of Corrections)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a list of currently employed mental health professionals within your state's Department of Corrections or its subsidiary agencies, as well as their contact information.

Specifically, I am requesting:

- Full names
- Job titles
- Assigned correctional facility
- Government-issued email addresses
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions)
- Department/division (e.g. Behavioral Health, Mental Health Services)

This request applies to the following roles: rehabilitative program coordinators, licensed psychologists, psychiatrists, clinical social workers, and other licensed mental health professionals serving incarcerated populations in state-operated facilities.

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Ma

Dear Andrew Ma: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Washington Department of Corrections. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW. Your request was received in this office on 5/15/2025 and given the reference number P052632-051525 for tracking purposes. 
This message is an automated confirmation of your request, and does not constitute an official Department acknowledgement under RCW 42.56.520. Agency staff will provide a separate correspondence formally acknowledging this request within 5 business days.

communications.subject: [Records Center] Public Records Request :: P052632-051525
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Andrew Ma: 

I acknowledge receipt of your public records request dated May 15, 2025, and received in our office on May 16, 2025. We have assigned this request a tracking number of P-52632.  Please refer to this number in all future communications regarding this request. 

You state your request to be for the following records: 
a list of currently employed mental health professionals within your state's Department of Corrections or its subsidiary agencies, as well as their contact information. 

Specifically, I am requesting: 

- Full names 
- Job titles 
- Assigned correctional facility 
- Government-issued email addresses 
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions) 
- Department/division (e.g. Behavioral Health, Mental Health Services) 

This request applies to the following roles: rehabilitative program coordinators, licensed psychologists, psychiatrists, clinical social workers, and other licensed mental health professionals serving incarcerated populations in state-operated facilities 

I interpret your request to be for the following records, current as of May 16, 2025 (the day your request was received): 

• A list of the following data for all Department of Correction (DOC) licensed psychologists, psychiatrists, mental health providers, and other behavioral health providers: 
o Full names 
o Job titles 
o Assigned work location 
o DOC issued phone # 
o DOC issued email address 

If my interpretation is incorrect, please notify through the request portal or email me at tonja.monroe@doc1.wa.gov. It is noted that you have requested these records in an Excel or CSV format, this request cannot always be accommodated since these formats cannot hold redactions should those be necessary. We will determine if this is possible once the records have been gathered. (mailto:tonja.monroe@doc1.wa.gov) 

Before proceeding with disclosure of the requested list of information, can you please clarify by filling out the uploaded , letting us know about your Commercial Purposes Declaration intended use of the records being requested. 

Please be advised that if I do not hear back from you within 30 days, this request will be administratively closed. This means that the Department will not further address the request, and that will be the date from which the PRA’s on-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review starts to run. 

Sincerely, 
Tonja Monroe, Public Records Specialist

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #P052632-051525
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Monroe: 

Thank you for your message and for clearly outlining the scope of the request — your interpretation is accurate.

I’ve completed and attached the Commercial Purposes Declaration, confirming that this request is not for a commercial purpose. The records are being requested to support outreach for a free, volunteer-led mindfulness and rehabilitation program for incarcerated individuals.

While I originally requested the records in Excel or CSV format, I completely understand that those formats may not accommodate redactions. If necessary, I’m happy to receive the records in PDF format instead.

Please let me know if anything further is needed. I appreciate your time and assistance.

Warm regards,
Andrew Ma

Mr. Ma: 

I am writing in follow up to your public records request, P-52633. I have uploaded 3 pages of records, along with the corresponding spreadsheet, identified as responsive to your request to the records portal. Please log in to your GovQA account to retrieve this installment. 

These documents are provided to you in accordance with the Public Records Act. By making agency documents available to you, the Department is not responsible for your use of the information or for any claims or liabilities that may result from your use or further dissemination. 

Please note that our database contained all of your requested datapoint except for business phone numbers. We are unable to provide that portion of your request in the format you requested. In order to provide you with this information we would have to individually pull up each staff member in a directory and print each of them out separately. Please let me know if you still want to receive these records. 

Please be advised that if you do not respond on or before August 21, 2025, the request is considered to have been fulfilled by this production of records and is closed on that date. This means that the Department will not further address the request, and that will be the date from which the PRA’s one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review starts to run. Please contact me within 30 days by e-mail or at the address below, if you have any questions.
